Description: Pink limestone figure of a hippopotamus with projection emerging from its back. Ears, eyes and nostrils are represented by small proturberances; the muzzle is long and thin. A longitudinal groove forms the mouth. The projection on the back is hollowed out, square in shape and pierced by 4 holes. It is one of pair with EA 43066
Curator's comments: Published: X. Droux, Twinned hippipotamus figurines of the Predynastic period, in: R. Friedman and P. Fiske (eds), Egypt at its Origins 3, OLA 205, Leuven, 2011, pp. 357-8, fig. 7, table 2 entry 4b.
